channel.title: CVE Feed for NetIQ -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NetIQ -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-12461|2024-09-16T17:18:10.522Z -- netiq -- edirectory
item.description: Fixed issues with NetIQ eDirectory prior to 9.1.1 when checking certificate revocation.

item.title: CVE-2017-14799|2024-09-16T17:23:57.367Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A cross site scripting attack in handling the ESP login parameter handling in NetIQ Access Manager before 4.3.3 could be used to inject javascript code into the login page.

item.title: CVE-2017-9280|2024-09-16T17:42:50.340Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager%20applications
item.description: Some NetIQ Identity Manager Applications before Identity Manager 4.5.6.1 included the session token in GET URLs, potentially allowing exposure of user sessions to untrusted third parties via proxies, referer urls or similar.

item.title: CVE-2017-14800|2024-09-16T20:31:45.697Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A reflected cross site scripting attack in the NetIQ Access Manager before 4.3.3 using the "typecontainerid" parameter of the policy editor could allowed code injection into pages of authenticated users.

item.title: CVE-2017-7419|2024-09-16T17:29:02.147Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A OAuth application in NetIQ Access Manager 4.3 before 4.3.2 and 4.2 before 4.2.4 allowed cross site scripting attacks due to unescaped "description" field that could be specified by the provider.

item.title: CVE-2018-12462|2024-09-16T18:56:13.274Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: NetIQ iManager 3.1.1 addresses potential XSS vulnerabilities.
